thread.title: Beyonce's dad teaching course on becoming a superstar
thread.title_full: Beyonce's dad teaching course on becoming a superstar - CNN.com

author: Natalie Weiner, Billboard
title: Beyonce's dad teaching course on becoming a superstar
text:
Story highlights Knowles helped to make his daughter a star He also offered the workshop last year (Billboard) Mathew Knowles, the man who brought us Destiny's Child and Beyoncé (in more ways than one), is ready to share his wisdom with the masses -- for the low, low price of $199.
Mathew Knowles says he's working on 'a few' Destiny's Child projects
Matthew Knowles used to manage his daughter Beyonce. Knowles, who remains to this day Destiny's Child's manager, is offering a one-day workshop called "The Entertainment Industry: How Do I Get In?" on Oct. 24 at Houston performing arts complex the Hobby Center. Targeted towards all "aspiring singers, dancers, composers, writers, producers, managers, publicists, attorneys, business managers and all other entertainment industry hopefuls," the class is not actually Knowles' first foray into education.
Beyonce's father sells her old merchandise at a garage sale
Aside from teaching a class at Texas Southern University called "The Recording Industry," Knowles actually offered this same workshop last fall, and a correspondent from MTV was there. Apparently, so was Houston rap stalwart Bun B.
Read More Beyonce gains stepmother as father Mathew Knowles gets married
What are the keys to being Beyoncé besides, well, being Beyoncé (it's worth noting that Knowles' latest book is called The DNA of Achievers)? You'll have to sign up for the course and find out -- after all, as Knowles put it in a recent interview, "We will not have a textbook, because I am the book."
Read the original story at Billboard.com.
